question.text: Which one single organism or the pair of organisms is correctly assigned to its or their named taxonomic group?

options.text: Paramecium and Plasmodium belong to the same kingdom as that of Penicillium
Lichen is a composite organism formed from the symbiotic association of an algae and a protozoan
Yeast used in making bread and beer is a fungus
Nostoc and Anabaena are examples of Protista

solution.text:
Yeast or Saccharomyces cerevisiae is a fungus of class-Ascomycetes. Saccharomyces sp. are widely used in baking and brewing industries. Paramecium and Plasmodium belong to kingdom-Protista, Penicillium belongs to kingdom-fungi. Lichen is a composite organism formed from the symbiotic association of algae and fungi.
Nostoc and Anabaena are examples of cyanobacteria or blue-green algae.
